main event: On 4th August 1952, in Santa Rosa, California, a round silver disc, estimated to be 12 to 15 feet in diameter, was observed moving at a speed of 50-70 mph over a two-hour period, for approximately 5 minutes each time. The object was also tracked on radar for 15 minutes, making rapid right-angle turns before suddenly accelerating and disappearing at a high speed.
interesting points: The unidentified object was reported to be round, bright, and luminous, with a diameter estimated to be 12 to 15 feet.
The speed of the object was estimated to be 400 to 500 miles per hour, and it made rapid right-angle turns before suddenly accelerating and disappearing at a high rate of speed.
The 4602nd Air Intelligence Service Squadron at Hamilton AFB, California, was assigned to investigate, but no further information is available to determine the identity of the object.
The observation of the object took place over a two-hour period, indicating prolonged and repeated sightings.
The report included both visual observation and radar tracking of the unidentified object, adding to the credibility of the sighting.
